name: Cabo Azul Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a fantastic resort, from beginning to end. Our check-in was friendly, helpful and fast. (yes, they ask about the timeshare tour, but are not pushy at all) The sense of arrival is not what it could be, as they have not finished their lobby yet. But once you leave check-in you will be happy with the resort. The rooms are truly wonderful. We were in a one bedroom villa. Beautiful master bedroom with the MOST comfortable king bed. The lighting is romantic at night. The jacuzzi tub off the bedroom is enormous. Great shower. The kitchen is beyond what you will ever need. And a nice couch and sitting area. We had a huge balcony area with tables and chairs.
reviews.title: Pure Bliss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds are plush and tropical. The pools are just gorgeous - 3 of them, one spilling into the next. 2 very large hot tub areas. At night the torches and fire pits create a beautiful ambiance. The poolside chairs are very comfy, and there are many different areas to choose from (upper pools, by beach, at beach) We really relaxed and enjoyed the resort. The food is quite pricey, but quite good. The drinks are very pricey, but I also had the best mudslide, mojito and rum runner I have ever tasted. Seriously. The service is just amazing. The first morning my husband and I met for breakfast after his workout in the fitness area (also very good). He had just had knee surgery a few weeks prior to the trip and had brought a bag of ice to put on his knee. As soon as the server noticed the ice he pulled up a stool for him to put his knee up. Completely unsolicited. There are several other similar stories.
reviews.title: Beautiful, Relaxing But Quiet Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is very nice to hear and watch the large waves crash outside, but be aware this is definitely not a beach to swim in or easily walk along for a distance. We were going for the sun, warmth and resort and could not have been happier. But the beach in this entire area (san jose del cabo) is more to see and hear then directly experience.
reviews.title: A Fantastic Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Make sure to go into town to shop and eat, it is very charming. We ate at La Panga Antigua (wow!) Salsitas and Tequilla and all were great experiences. If you love Mexican food there are 2 less touristy places you should visit: The pancake house (not fancy at all but amazing breakfast food) and Taqueria Rossy (lunch seafood tacos - amazing).
reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful
1st Anniversary Celebration
reviews.text: We had a wonderful trip. Amazing weather and resort, great town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel is the most beautiful I have ever been to. And luckily I have been to a lot.
reviews.title: Beautiful! Worth it!
Fantastic
reviews.text: The rooms are beautifully decorated, the hotel grounds are very green, and the pool (three different temperatures) was stunning and refreshing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I can not say enough great things about this hotel. My mother, father, and me and my two adult brothers (whom have rather high expectations) all wanted to move in. Too the location is convenient to Cabo San Lucas if you want nightlife, though the town of San Jose del Cabo which it is located in is a much prettier place to be. The town is filled with art galleries, and shops (not the usual touristy stuff) the restaurants too are some of the best.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Brand New Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011
reviews.text: This is an excellent resort in all aspects. The food choices are very reasonable. There is an on-site market selling typical groceries, we used it for our breakfast needs. There is also a small cafe type restaurant adjacent to the market. At pool side, they have a restaurant that offers specially priced tacos at $25-$35 pesos each. The main restaurant Javiers is obviously pricey, but not outrageous.
reviews.title: It was the most luxurious place ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The 3 infinity pools are just the right temperature, very spacious, and open 7 to 10. We had a great time at the pools. Too bad the beach is too dangerous to swim in due to rip tides. Not sure if this is how things are year round.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Cabo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is a fantastic resort, the design and the attention to details of the design is the best I've seen. The grounds are immaculate, the infinity pools the best we have ever experienced, and with warm and friendly staff. The pool side restaurant has a wonderful taco special on alternating days. Javier's is pricey but the service and the food are worth the price. They also have an informal cafe with more reasonably priced items. The marketplace can get a little pricey, so it may be worth going to nearby Mega supermarket to pick up food supplies instead.
reviews.title: beautifully designed but with some bugs to be worked out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Now the negatives. The hotel is still under construction, so there is no formal entrance, they are using couple of the "villas" as front desk and concierge. If you look back on tripadvisor, they have been under construction since '07. Does not seem like there's any active effort to get this thing completed for now.
reviews.title: Outstanding!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This place is amazing. Between the three infinity pools that give a direct view of the ocean, the swim-up bar, the poolside cabanas, and the beautifully furnished rooms, it's hard to want to leave and see the rest of Los Cabos. However, if you do venture out, you will be very close to San Jose Del Cabo, which is the quieter, less-commercial town, which has amazing local art and food. The property is also near the Estero with lots of wildlife, where you can horseback ride with beautiful views.
reviews.title: Surrounded by beauty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is luxury at it's finest and includes little extra touches such as towel service at the pool, fitness classes and daily newspapers. Every staff person, from the check-in crew to the concierge, is friendly and helpful. The rooms are beautiful, the kitchen is fully stocked, and the balcony is great. The only issue is that the lighting and mirrors in the bathrooms are more aesthetic than functional.
reviews.title: Wonderful vacation at a beautiful resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We just got back from 6 days at the Cabo Azul and absolutely loved it.
reviews.title: The facts about Cabo Azul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: The pool area is absolutely wonderful and, to me, got better every day we were there. What other reviews haven’t mentioned is the quality of the lounge chairs and towels. The pool chairs and cocoon pods have thick foam mattresses on wooden frames with covers that are changed daily. It’s one of the many details that show how wonderful the service at the resort is. Except for the pillows, but we could deal.
reviews.title: it was amazing experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like everyone else has noted, there is no lobby and it’s one of the few downsides of the resort. They said it will be done this year, but we didn’t see any construction being done. The place deserves a great lobby, and they should really finish it, even though they’re getting great reviews without it.
reviews.title: Even More Beautiful In Person - than pics can describe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a 4 night stay package for $699 through Luxury Link. I didn't expect much for the price, but once we got to the resort...HOLY FRIJOLE! This place is GORGEOUS! From my past reviews you'll know that I'm all about design, design, design. I was so taken by the aesthetics, architecture and details that I nearly changed my Bali wedding plans to have it in their monolithic chapel. Dodd Mitchell designed the interiors and I'm sure he is the one responsible for the chapel and Javiers restaurant, but his use of scale, materials and texture is mind-blowing. You'll love the two fully sound-proofed sliding doors that magically disappear into the wall and open up to your own balcony. And we wanted to take home the pool 'cacoons' if only they collapsed into our luggage. Oh, and the spa...the coolest I've seen in a long time.
reviews.title: I heart Cabo Azul!

likes.disliked: — Expensive food and drink, having to pay for internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The worst I can say about the rooms is that the luxurious pillowtop beds are too soft for my back. No biggie. The timeshare presentation? Ack. Really high pressure, but they threw in a couple of massages. Hold your ground. Meals and drinks are expensive (about $75-100/couple/meal), so we spent $100 at the Mega supermarket and got 6 meals out of it by cooking in our villa, and filling our water bottles with homemade margaritas by the pool. Bring your Mexican recipes for the best deal on ingredients - there is no fresh basil and pasta is pricey). Dinner in town will also set you back $100/couple. The spa is also about $100/50 mins for a massage; the price is ok but not great.
reviews.title: Paradise

likes.disliked: — you can't swim at the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008
reviews.text: What's suprising is that we will definitely be back many many times, especially with friends and family. And that is the FIRST time I've ever said that about any place in Mexico.
reviews.title: Great Resort!

likes.disliked: — pushy timeshare presentation, trying to get a gardenview room with a garden view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cabo Azul is the best resort by far that I have stayed in. The pool area is amazing and grounds are just gorgeous. We stayed in a one bedroom villa with an ocean view. The bed is extremely comfortable and it came with jacuzi tub which came in handy after that long day. The hotel is a brisk 20 min. walk from downtown san jose where you will find amazing restaurants and art galleries. The only bad spot about the hotel is that you can not swim in the beach directly in front of it due to a very strong current. Try the shrimp ceviche at the bar.
reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon!

likes.disliked: — Mexico is too far for us to return anytime soon :-(

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Cabo Azul on a timeshare special - 4 days for $300 if we attended a presentation. Obviously the presentation was lame, and we had to fight to get a garden-view room that actually had a view of the garden and not a parking lot, but the resort itself was great.
reviews.title: Cannot wait to return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We read many other reviews on this site before choosing Cabo Azul and spent 7 days in a two bedroom villa as part of their romantic getaway package.
reviews.title: Will be great when it's finished

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our first impressions were mixed. We were caught at the airport by our first timeshare salesman who became increasingly desperate as we decided not to take him up on his offer of a free presentation. We were caught again on the bus to the hotel, again by the concierge and yet again at the supermarket. It was ridiculous. Beware - unless you intend to purchase a timeshare - avoid anyone offering to help you! After the initial irritations we were very pleased with our villa.
reviews.title: Even BETTER than we could have imagined!!!

likes.liked: — Beautiful grounds, NEW hotel, cleanliness and staff service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As noted by another reviewer, this hotel is far from finished. The concierge desk and entrance are all rather makeshift but they work. The sounds of construction are always around you but they are not awful - except one night when work continued late into the night.
reviews.title: Amazing Resort!

likes.liked: — Friendly staff and the bedside spa tub!
likes.disliked: — Food and drinks were a little pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was upgraded to a two bedroom sea view villa which was spectacular. The finishes are excellent and they are well appointed. The kitchen included all the amenities and were spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort

likes.disliked: — room too dark and AC not cool enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The pool is fabulous and the swim up bar is efficient. Food is good and the service at the bars is good. Pool service is sketchy at best - depends where you sit and who is on duty. The gym is excellent and includes top quality equipment.
reviews.title: The most amazing vacation ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pictures on the resort website are accurate. Our one-bedroom villa was spacious, very clean, and beautifully decorated. All the lights had dimmer controls and were indirect. The bedroom had a jacuzzi tub, the kitchen was complete and had stainless steel appliances, and the patio was large. The hotel was quiet at night. Housekeeping did a great job cleaning our room.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort & amazing room, Expensive food/drinks, Annoying concierge orientation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool area was really nice and surrounded by lots of green landscaping. There were lots of available beach chairs located both around the pool and on the beach. The staff made sure that the hotel beach area was vendor free. The pool area was illuminated at night and looked absolutely beautiful.
reviews.title: Perfect Romantic Gateaway
The Best Spring Break.
reviews.text: The atmosphere was very relaxing. Guests were primarily in their early 30s-70s, and there were few children. The market on the premises was convenient.

reviews.title: Beautiful but lacking in administration and customer service.
reviews.text: Complaints:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a very long day of travel we were tired and hungry and just wanted to get our key and go to our room. However we were forced to meet with the pushy inpatient rude concierge before we could get our key. It was more like like a sales pitch under the guise of a hotel orientation. Luckily, we were not approached for a sales talk at any other time.
reviews.title: Absolutly to DIE FOR ! Fierce !!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The end of June 2010 I spent four nights at the Cabo Azul. The reason for the trip was to attend a wedding that was being held there, which explains my reason for going there that time of year.
reviews.title: So Close to Being Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This is a relatively large resort and it has a great ocean setting. There are three large pools and more than one hot tub. A note to parents: no toys or things are allowed in the pools so beware. The beach area is great but I doubt that there’s ever a time when the surf here is going to be good for swimming.
reviews.title: Went for a friend's 50th birthday party!
Great Place to Stay!!
reviews.text: My initial impression when checking in wasn’t a good one. First, the “front desk” area is tiny; there is no grand reception area, no scenic sitting area, etc. Secondly, they immediately put the sell on you to do the time-share thing with them. The check-in process went efficiently until we got to the part where they hand us our electronic key, at which point the young woman who’s checking us in goes, “While I prepare your keys, please see the concierge next door who has a gift for you.” Of course this was a lead-in to the whole time-share thing and I told her that I wasn’t interested in any gift, would never want a time-share, and please give me my keys since I’ve paid for a room. Of course, preparing an electronic key takes about 2.5 seconds. The woman was startled and started to resist but relented when she saw I wasn’t going to budge. Okay, not a big deal but I’m paying for a room at a place that’s supposed to be classy and here they’re pulling this cheesy gambit. Some of our friends complained that when they checked in they were told they wouldn’t be given their key until they had seen the concierge… so, you’ve been warned.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now, that said, the facility itself was very nice. Our room, which was number 6603, was on the top floor (we had gotten a “wedding party” rate, which was very reasonable). Our view was of the pool areas with the ocean beyond and was beautiful. We had a suite (they may all be suites), which was relatively spacious, including a small kitchen. There’s an enormous bathtub in the bedroom, and then a bathroom room area with a shower. The decorations were all tasteful and the room was very comfortable with massive doors that opened up onto a large balcony area. There were also ceiling fans in the rooms and a good air conditioning system that was able to cool the rooms down to about 67 degrees at night.
reviews.title: We got married at Cabo Azul and are so glad we did.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The things about our suite that were less than wonderful: First, lighting. There are lots and lots of lights in the suite, and lots of light switches. You can do all kinds of mood lighting. However, the bathroom mirror area is DIM, at best. Many of the light switches have built-in dimmers so you have to be careful that the dimmers are at high, however, even with that, the bathroom area is dim, dim, dim. Other members of our party talked about the same thing; the women resorted to going out on the balcony with handheld mirrors.
reviews.title: 20 Year Anniversary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just returned from my anniversary stay at this property and can truly say this place is breath taking! I, like many on this site, am well traveled and have stayed at many appealing properties but this takes the cake! I had wanted to stay here for quite some time and am so thrilled we were able to experience Cabo Azul!
reviews.title: WOW! Cabo Azul EXTREMELY Impressive!
Beware! Bedbugs!
reviews.text: I arrived coming from another hotel (I stayed in two properties during my 10 day vacation in Cabo) at 10:30 AM and my room was ready for check-in! Immediately, we were taken to a "welcome package" area where you get a map of the resort, pamplets and the opportunity to take part in a Monarch Vacation timeshare presentation for great discounts and other things. We respectfully declined as we had been in Cabo for a week and had our fill of excursions and it was NO problem whatsoever. No complaints, no "sharking", nothing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Within 5 minutes we were take to our room which was absolutely INCREDIBLE!! It was clean, chic, sexy and VERY beautiful! We had a one bedroom villa as it was just my husband and myself in building 6, right above the pool and close to the market plaza (which had the BEST sandwiches, gelato and breakfast!) and chapel. The lighting in the room wasn't a problem at all. In fact, we found it to be extremely romantic! The light fixtures and furniture were high quality and much appreciated. You could tell that a lot of thought went into the design and layout of the rooms. The kitchen area was not your normal "vacation rental" kitchen. It had a full stove, not just burners, OXO kitchen gadgets and tools and high quality appliances. It was perfect!
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The resort is in a PERFECT location and is away from the hustle and bustle of Cabo San Lucas (not my cup of tea). The grounds are pristine and kept well. So well that at night, two workers use a flashlight to check under EVERY SINGLE pool lounge to look for garbage and items left behind! There are so many chairs around the gorgeous pool and I carefully watched to see if they'd check each one and they sure did! The pool had 3 levels and is just as beautiful at night as it is durning the day. Cabo Azul honestly has the most comfortable pool lounges I've ever used! Excellent waiter staff also! I already miss you Adrian! :)
reviews.title: Fantastic resort, very few complaints

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Flor de Noche and Javier's are their restaurants and equally delicious! The range of choices and portions are incredible! Pricey, yes. I just don't know anywhere I've ever been on vacation when that isn't the case though. If you get the chance to eat at Javier's, DEFINITELY get a table outside at around 8 to see the sun set and moon rise. Truly a sight to see!
reviews.title: Great fun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I visited Cabo Azul for a quick four day getaway in April - Travelzoo special like everybody else. We were pleasantly surprised by our enormous two bedroom suite. The hotel was completely modern and provided wonderful ammenitiies - great pools that were clean, a variety of temperatures, and allowed for ample seating (never a rush to get a spot as with many hotel pools). Our suite had a kithcen with everything you could possibly need - modern appliances, great plates, and the like. We cooked several of our dinners which I would highly recommend as the hotel restaurants and restauarants in San Jose were all equally expensive - along the lines of costlier bars/rests. in Los Angeles in NY. We did hit a few in San Jose and they were well worth the cost given their charm (Mi Cocina and Morgans). There has been much said about the dark lighting in the second bedroom - I am not sure what the big deal is - open the door and walk into the main suite. Perhaps I am missing something - it really was not a bother. What was a bother was attempting to have our room made up - housekeeping forgot us every single day. We had to call and remind the front desk every afternoon. Do know that housekeeping is included - but you may have to ask for it. The only major pitfall of our stay was our experience with the front desk at checkout. Eduardo was extremely rude and condescending. I had several questions about my Amex receipt (they take a copy of your card when you check in for incidentals like many hotels). Rather than politely discussing how they address additional charges, Eduardo asked me if it was my first time in Mexico. While I replied that it was my first visit to the hotel, I was not born yesterday and did not appreciate his general tone. When I walked away, he made an equally snooty comment - not the best way to end a pleasant vacation. I would recommend Cabo Azul to friends, however, there seemed to be quite a few similar properties in the area. If you are looking for a touch better service, you might consider elsewhere. Otherwise, Cabo Azul is a great looking hotel.
reviews.title: Comfortable Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: This resort is part of Monarch Grand Vacations which I'm an owner. I was so surprised and pleased at how nice it was. I had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath ocean view. It was beautiful and so peaceful. The sliding glass doors opened all the way across the wall in the living room and the master bedroom. We also faced the garden, infinity pool and open-aired restaurant. It was 30 mins from the port of Cabo San Lucas. There's a car rental right on property, along with a small market and a deli with Gelato and Javier's. We also found 2 small casinos (mainly slots), Caliente at the Puerto Paraiso Mall and Royale, about 3 blocks from the mall.
reviews.title: Surprisingly delightful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just got back from our 4 night, 5 day stay at Cabo Azul Resort. We got an amazing deal from Travelzoo and we really thought it would be too good to be true. But, it wasn't!
reviews.title: Perfect Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel had a shuttle waiting for us at the airport which was complimentary. Was a huge help since we didn't need to deal with all the craziness at the airport. The airport is a 10 minute cab ride to the resort. Upon arriving to the hotel, we were greeted by hotel staff who were very friendly and helpful. We arrived around 3pm, and our room was ready. We were given a "pool view" room, however since we were on the first floor the only view we had was of the landscape surrounding the pool :) I didn't make a big deal about it since we really were not planning on spending much time in our room anyway. We had a one bedroom suite. The room is VERY big and can definitely accomodate 4 people, especially a family traveling with kids. The kitchen was stocked with top of the line appliances, including a blender, toaster and microwave in addition to the dishwasher and stove top. Refrigertor was huge, so make sure to stock up at the Mega store down the street for basic necessities (water, soda, snacks, etc). Only issue with the room was the noisy A/C. I'm a light sleeper....
reviews.title: Great place for a family trip BUT dont have your wedding there!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Onto the property itself - The grounds are beautiful. There are three infinity pools that overlook the ocean. Plenty of lounge chairs, very comfortable and cozy :) Pool service is great, always someone around to help with umbrellas and to order food or drinks. Food is very good and they have happy hour 2 for 1 drinks in the afternoons.
reviews.title: Relaxation at it's best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011
reviews.text: If you like to lounge around the pool and drink, this is the perfect place. The rooms are georgeous. A little dark but manageable.
reviews.title: If you like to lounge around the pool...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you like to be out and about, this is NOT the place for you. The closest city is small and old and dirty. There are no activities within about 30 minutes off the resort.
reviews.title: Hands Down The Best Resort In Cabo!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: To get to activities you have to drive or take an overpriced taxi to get you there and back. The activities are very pricey. Be prepared to pay out the nose to do anything.
reviews.title: Gorgeous resort, great service, we loved everything!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Cabo Azul Resort & Spa is simply amazing. We booked it through an introductory special on the hotel website for an amazing rate for a 5-star resort. I would pay more to go back.
reviews.title: A Beautiful, Romantic, and Luxurious Resort - AMAZING!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were beyond expectations - and we were in a the smallest Suite without a garden view. I expected to get something much smaller and less beautiful than what is pictured on the website, but what we got was incredible. Huge room with full equipped kitchedn, living room, bathroom with a great shower, and master bedroom with full size hot tub right in the room. What blew us away was the lighting. They paid attention to every little detail when they designed the resort, and the cool decor, lighting, and designs will keep you looking around in awe. There's also dimmer swithes on everything, so you can always set the perfect mood.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Outside the room was just as amazing as in it. The 3-tier infinity pool with swim-up bar is a dream come true. The cabanas and pool-side chairs are amazingly comfy and the pool is perfectly designed for lazily floating around all day. At night there are really creative torches and fire pits that light up to create another great atmosphere - and you can stay out by the pool to all hours!
reviews.title: This place is simply beautiful and amazing!

likes.liked: — Clean, friendly service and the Resort is simply Beautiful!
likes.disliked: — None. After a whole week, not one suggested change!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaraunt with the swim-up bar "Flor de Noche" has good (Americanized) food, but delicous salsa and great margaritas! (we we had plenty of). The staff was friendly and courteous, and they didn't push the time-share presentation more than asking one time and we declined.
reviews.title: MISLEAD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was clean, beautiful, and a dream come true.
reviews.title: Be Aware...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Cabo Azul may not be the One and Only Palmilla (so sick of reading other people's reviews comparing the two) but unless you're willing to get a second mortgage to afford the latter, it's a wonderful place to stay. The rooms are gorgeous, decorated in a very high end Spanish style, and the enormous negative edge pools are fabulous. Though the place is still partially under construction (the check-in is still in a converted unit), my family and I had a fantastic time. The food and drink prices at the pool bar/ restaurant aren't cheap, but the prices are fair for a resort, the food is good and the chips and salsa are fantastic. There's a little convenience store on site or for a more authentic experience, the Mega Mart is just a $5 cab ride away, so if you want you can stock up on groceries and utilize the full kitchen in your room. The resort is pristine and beautiful and though the riptides make the ocean too dangerous to swim in, you can still lie out on the beach, and the kids loved playing in the sand. There are plenty of lounges at the pool, however there really aren't enough attendants there to wait on you hand and foot, if that's the kind of experience you're looking for. (Keep in mind, however, that this is Mexico, and everyone is willing to help as long as you are willing to tip.) The place is family-friendly, but there weren't too many children so I think this would be an acceptable place for a romantic vacation as well. Though I visited as a guest of my sister-in-law who is part of the timeshare, there were many guests I met who booked independently and seemed pleased with what they were getting for their money. Be wary of any promises made to you, however, if you opt to attend the timeshare presentation - if you do not buy, those promises may mysteriously be forgotten. Cabo overall is very Americanized and expensive, but at least in San Jose del Cabo you still have a quaint old town that isn't totally overcommercialized. If you have money to spend, there are lots of activities you can do from Cabo San Lucas: snorkeling, ziplining, jetskiing, fishing, shopping, etc. Just make sure you go into Cabo San Lucas for one day, go into San Jose one day, and relax the rest of the time, and your experience should be as awesome as ours was!
reviews.title: Awesome!

likes.disliked: — a little more nightlife would have been nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cabo Azul is beautiful! The staff was incredibly kind and even got to know our names! We loved lounging by the pool and relaxing... In fact it was so nice we didn't really leave the resort for the entire 3 days we where there. We did have dinner in Cabo one night ($30 cab ride to and from Cabo FYI)....
reviews.title: LOVED LOVED IT!

likes.liked: — huge pool and hot tub, amazing spa, great service
likes.disliked: — the sales pitch to buy into their timeshare program

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Overall, I would highly recommend this resort! It is still under construction - but we didn't really even notice.
reviews.title: Beyond words.....fantastic staff

likes.liked: — The pool, The staff, The proximity to San Jose Del Cabo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My family of 5 returned from Cabo Azul at the end of June. 3 daughters (18, 16 and 9) plus myself and husband. We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa. We CANNOT wait to go back. The property is absolutely gorgeous
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort, but beauty isnt everything

likes.liked: — Resort is very beautiful and new

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ....and we usually stay at only 5 star properties. The check in area may be small but the friendliness of the staff overshadow this very small and temporary fact. The new lobby will be fantastic once completed.
reviews.title: Loved the Property

likes.disliked: — The poor lighting in the room, but easily made up for by the great experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: I will make this short and sweet. Cabo Azul is definitely a mini paradise. This resort is defintely a 4-5 star.
reviews.title: I defintely will go back....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: PROS:
reviews.title: Fabulous place for a family group vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: In June my son had a wedding there. It was my first time to Mexico and all I can say was it was "Fabulous!". The room was immaculate, the calm, serene, zen ambience and the most beautiful views of the ocean. The landscaping, infiniti pools, halls were impeccable
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: and the staff service was warm, caring and respectible. I loved it! Much gratitude to all the staff for making the wedding, food and stay the most memorable....
reviews.title: Beach not for swimming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife & I loved the resort. Great facilities and service. The only reason we didn't give it five stars is a couple key things that were not made clear before we got there: We had hoped to be able to jump into the ocean and play in the surf, but the ocean along that resort strip is too dangerous for swimming or surfing. Also, the "villas" (that have multiple rooms) have wired Internet but no wi-fi. We only brought our iPads, so no internet in the room for us — had to bring our iPads to the pool to go online. But those were our only disappointments with the place. Otherwise fantastic.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel and pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to the Cabo Azul Resort. I was surprised that the hotel was still under construction. We arrived and the lobby is really not a lobby but a temporary lobby located in a back corner. ( no biggie) Before you can get your key to your room you need to listen to a speech about time shares. I had no idea this was a timeshare property. We booked the penthouse suite. The property is very beautiful but we found it too dark. Our suite was just ok. Three bedrooms, living room and kitchen. The master suite was poorly decorated and by far the least desirable room. The bathroom was so dark you couldn't see at night what so ever. Don't even think about putting make up on in the master bathroom....... The other rooms were nicely decorated and great bathrooms.
reviews.title: Loved it! Definitely coming back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our jacuzzi didn't work very well, however the maintenance department did there best to fix it. The restaurants were delicious and we really enjoyed the pool and bar. The spa was fantastic! I believe I had my best treatment ever at the Cabo Azul! And talk about beautiful!!!! The spa area is so beautiful!!!!!!
reviews.title: My 2nd visit in 6 months!!!

aka: Cabo Azul Hotel San Jose Del Cabo
description: Cabo Azul Resort is an award-winning resort that features an award-winning spa, Paz. This resort also has a purpose built, $15 million wedding chapel, Corazon, that overlooks the resort out to the Sea of Cortez.
